data.event: Originally granted to the Waratah Coal Company, the area was the site of the company's first shaft, sunk in 1873.

event.title: applied to Charlestown in its early days

data.event: These names all applied to Charlestown in its early days and the surviving name seem to have been derived from that of Charles Smith, the company's manager.
The company had the area surveyed on 29 April 1876; the first subdivision later became Ida Street, Pearson Street, Milson Street and Frederick Streets.
Harry Wright bought the first lot when it was auctioned later in 1876.
